name: scrubby
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
covered with short trees and bushes: a scrubby landscape
Scrubby plants, bushes, or trees are shorter than normal: scrubby vegetation See
scrub
More examplesFewer examplesEl Rancho is in the scrubby lowlands of eastern Guatemala. the austere expanse of scrubby desert and jagged mountains the historical landscape of the old farm fields, now scrubby and overgrownRanches are rising quickly on the scrubby slopes and in narrow valleys. The local dark-sand beaches can be scrubby. The land was flat and dry, freckled with scrubby bushes. The meadow grasses were trampled down to scrubby clumps. It is mostly rocks and scrubby trees, and there seem few places to hide.
